an5.191:1.1: “Mendicants, these five ancient traditions of the brahmins are exhibited these days among hounds, but not among brahmins.
an5.191:1.3: In the past brahmins had sex only with brahmin women, not with others.
an5.191:1.4: These days brahmins have sex with both brahmin women and others.
an5.191:1.5: But these days hounds have sex only with female hounds, not with other species.
an5.191:1.6: This is the first ancient tradition of the brahmins exhibited these days among hounds, but not among brahmins.
an5.191:2.1: In the past brahmins had sex only with brahmin women in the fertile phase of the menstrual cycle, not at other times.
an5.191:2.2: These days brahmins have sex with brahmin women both in the fertile phase of the menstrual cycle and at other times.
an5.191:2.3: But these days hounds have sex only with female hounds when they are in heat, not at other times.
an5.191:2.4: This is the second ancient tradition of the brahmins exhibited these days among hounds, but not among brahmins.
an5.191:3.1: In the past brahmins neither bought nor sold brahmin women. They lived together because they loved each other and wanted their family line to continue.
an5.191:3.2: These days brahmins both buy and sell brahmin women. They live together whether they love each other or not and they want their family line to continue.
an5.191:3.3: But these days hounds neither buy nor sell female hounds. They live together because they’re attracted to each other and want their family line to continue.
an5.191:3.4: This is the third ancient tradition of the brahmins exhibited these days among hounds, but not among brahmins.
an5.191:4.1: In the past brahmins did not store up money, grain, silver, or gold.
an5.191:4.2: These days brahmins do store up money, grain, silver, and gold.
an5.191:4.3: But these days hounds don’t store up money, grain, silver, or gold.
an5.191:4.4: This is the fourth ancient tradition of the brahmins exhibited these days among hounds, but not among brahmins.
an5.191:5.1: In the past brahmins went looking for almsfood for dinner in the evening, and for breakfast in the morning.
an5.191:5.2: These days brahmins eat as much as they like until their bellies are full, then take away the leftovers.
an5.191:5.3: But these days hounds go looking for dinner in the evening, and for breakfast in the morning.
an5.191:5.4: This is the fifth ancient tradition of the brahmins exhibited these days among hounds, but not among brahmins.
an5.191:5.5: These five ancient traditions of the brahmins are exhibited these days among hounds, but not among brahmins.”
